revised_title: New Classes of Exact Solutions of the Navier-Stokes Equations in Shear Flows
tldr: The authors present new classes of exact solutions for the Navier-Stokes equations in shear flows, describing spatially periodic disturbances within two- and three-dimensional basic shear flows. These solutions, called Kelvin modes, have time-dependent wavenumber and velocity components and can either decay or grow continuously despite viscous dissipation. The study includes two-dimensional flows with uniform vorticity and stagnation point flows.
